query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
1 Poscia che ’ncontro a la vita presente 2 d’i miseri mortali aperse ’l vero 3 quella che ’mparadisa la mia mente,
4 come in lo specchio fiamma di doppiero 5 vede colui che se n’alluma retro, 6 prima che l’abbia in vista o in pensiero,
7 e sé rivolge per veder se ’l vetro 8 li dice il vero, e vede ch’el s’accorda 9 con esso come nota con suo metro;
10 così la mia memoria si ricorda 11 ch’io feci riguardando ne’ belli occhi 12 onde a pigliarmi fece Amor la corda.
query.result:
English:
1 After that she who makes my mind a paradise 2 opened the truth to the present life 3 of wretched mortals,
4 as in a mirror the flame of a torch 5 is seen by one who lights it from behind, 6 before he has it in sight or in thought,
7 and he turns to see if the glass 8 tells him the truth, and sees that it agrees 9 with it as a note with its meter;
10 so my memory remembers 11 that I did, looking into the beautiful eyes 12 from which Love made the cord to capture me.
Esperanto:
1 Poste ke kontraŭ la vivo nuna 2 de la mizeraj mortontoj malfermis la veron 3 tiu kiu paradizas mian menson,
4 kiel en la spegulo flamo de torĉo 5 vidas tiu kiu ĝin ekbruligas malantaŭe, 6 antaŭ ol li havas ĝin en vido aŭ en penso,
7 kaj sin turnas por vidi ĉu la vitro 8 diras al li la veron, kaj vidas ke ĝi konsentas 9 kun ĝi kiel noto kun sia metro;
10 tiel mia memoro memoras 11 ke mi faris rigardante en la belajn okulojn 12 el kiuj por kapti min faris Amoro la ŝnuron.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
13 E com’ io mi rivolsi e furon tocchi 14 li miei da ciò che pare in quel volume, 15 quandunque nel suo giro ben s’adocchi,
16 un punto vidi che raggiava lume 17 acuto sì, che ’l viso ch’elli affoca 18 chiuder conviensi per lo forte acume;
19 e quale stella par quinci più poca, 20 parrebbe luna, locata con esso 21 come stella con stella si collòca.

Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
22 Forse cotanto quanto pare appresso 23 alo cigner la luce che ’l dipigne 24 quando ’l vapor che ’l porta più è spesso,
25 distante intorno al punto un cerchio d’igne 26 si girava sì ratto, ch’avria vinto 27 quel moto che più tosto il mondo cigne;
28 e questo era d’un altro circumcinto, 29 e quel dal terzo, e ’l terzo poi dal quarto, 30 dal quinto il quarto, e poi dal sesto il quinto.

Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
31 Sopra seguiva il settimo sì sparto 32 già di larghezza, che ’l messo di Iuno 33 intero a contenerlo sarebbe arto.

Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
40 La donna mia, che mi vedëa in cura 41 forte sospeso, disse: «Da quel punto 42 depende il cielo e tutta la natura.
query.result:
English:
40 My lady, who saw me in such care, 41 deeply troubled, said: "On that point 42 depend heaven and all of nature.
Esperanto:
40 Mia damo, kiu vidis min en zorgo 41 forte maltrankvila, diris: "De tiu punkto 42 dependas la ĉielo kaj la tuta naturo.
Please note that the word "cura" in line 40 can also mean "care" or "concern" in English, so another possible translation of the first line is: "My lady, who saw me in such concern".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
43 Mira quel cerchio che più li è congiunto; 44 e sappi che ’l suo muovere è sì tosto 45 per l’affocato amore ond’ elli è punto».
query.result:
English:
43 Look at the circle that is closest to it; 44 and know that its movement is so swift 45 because of the fiery love by which it is spurred.
Esperanto:
43 Rigardu tiun ĉielosferon kiu estas plej proksima al ĝi; 44 kaj sciu ke ĝia moviĝo estas tiel rapida 45 pro la arda amo de kiu ĝi estas pikita.
Please note that the word "punto" in line 45 can also mean "stung" or "pricked" in English, so another possible translation of the last line is: "because of the fiery love by which it is stung".

English:
46 And I to her: "If the world were arranged 47 with the order that I see in those wheels, 48 that which is proposed to me would satisfy me;
49 but in the sensible world one can see 50 the circles to be all the more divine 51 the more remote they are from the center.
Esperanto:
46 Kaj mi al ŝi: "Se la mondo estus aranĝita 47 kun la ordo kiun mi vidas en tiuj ĉielosferoj, 48 tion kio estas proponita al mi kontentigus min;
49 sed en la sensa mondo oni povas vidi 50 la ĉielosferojn esti des pli diaj, 51 ju pli ili estas foraj de la centro.
Please note that the word "posto" in line 47 can also mean "placed" or "arranged" in English, so another possible translation of the first line is: "If the world were placed with the order that I see in those wheels".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
52 Onde, se ’l mio disir dee aver fine 53 in questo miro e angelico templo 54 che solo amore e luce ha per confine,
55 udir convienmi ancor come l’essemplo 56 e l’essemplare non vanno d’un modo, 57 ché io per me indarno a ciò contemplo».
query.result:
English:
52 Therefore, if my desire is to have an end 53 in this wondrous and angelic temple 54 that has only love and light as its boundaries,
55 it is fitting for me to hear further how the exemplar 56 and the example do not proceed in the same way, 57 for I contemplate this in vain by myself.
Esperanto:
52 Sekve, se mia deziro devas havi finon 53 en tiu mirinda kaj anĝela templo 54 kiu havas nur amon kaj lumon kiel limojn,
55 necesas ke mi aŭdu ankoraŭ kiel la modelo 56 kaj la ekzemplo ne iras laŭ la sama maniero, 57 ĉar mi vane pri tio kontemplas per mi mem.
Please note that the word "templo" in line 53 can also mean "temple" or "sanctuary" in English, so another possible translation of the third line is: "in this wondrous and angelic sanctuary".
Also, the word "essemplo" in lines 55 and 56 can also mean "example" or "instance" in English, so another possible translation of those lines is: "it is fitting for me to hear further how the model and the example do not proceed in the same way".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
58 «Se li tuoi diti non sono a tal nodo 59 sufficïenti, non è maraviglia: 60 tanto, per non tentare, è fatto sodo!».
query.result:
English:
58 "If your fingers are not sufficient for such a knot, 59 it is no wonder: 60 so strong has it been made, so as not to be tested!"
Esperanto:
58 "Se viaj fingroj ne sufiĉas por tia nodo, 59 ne estas miro: 60 tiom, por ne provi, ĝi estas farita forta!"
Please note that the word "nodo" in line 58 can also mean "knot" or "difficulty" in English, so another possible translation of the first line is: "If your fingers are not sufficient for such a difficulty".
Also, the word "tentare" in line 60 can also mean "to attempt" or "to test" in English, so another possible translation of the last line is: "so strong has it been made, so as not to be attempted".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
61 Così la donna mia; poi disse: «Piglia 62 quel ch’io ti dicerò, se vuo’ saziarti; 63 e intorno da esso t’assottiglia.
query.result:
English:
61 Thus my lady; then she said: "Take 62 what I will tell you, if you wish to be satisfied; 63 and refine your mind around it.
Esperanto:
61 Tiel mia damo; poste ŝi diris: "Prenu 62 tion kion mi diros al vi, se vi volas satiĝi; 63 kaj ĉirkaŭ ĝi subtiligxu.
Please note that the word "assottiglia" in line 63 can also mean "to refine" or "to subtilize" in English, so another possible translation of the last line is: "and refine your mind around it".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
64 Li cerchi corporai sono ampi e arti 65 secondo il più e ’l men de la virtute 66 che si distende per tutte lor parti.
query.result:
English:
64 The corporeal circles are wide and narrow 65 according to the more and the less of the virtue 66 that is distributed throughout all their parts.
Esperanto:
64 La korpaj ĉielosferoj estas vastaj kaj mallarĝaj 65 laŭ la pli kaj la malpli de la virto 66 kiu etendiĝas tra ĉiuj iliaj partoj.
Please note that the word "arti" in line 64 can also mean "narrow" or "confined" in English, so another possible translation of the first line is: "The corporeal circles are wide and confined".
Also, the word "virtute" in line 66 can also mean "virtue" or "power" in English, so another possible translation of the last line is: "that is distributed throughout all their parts".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
67 Maggior bontà vuol far maggior salute; 68 maggior salute maggior corpo cape, 69 s’elli ha le parti igualmente compiute.
query.result:
English:
67 Greater goodness wants to produce greater salvation; 68 greater salvation requires a greater body, 69 if it has its parts equally complete.
Esperanto:
67 Pli granda boneco volas fari pli grandan savon; 68 pli granda savo postulas pli grandan korpon, 69 se ĝi havas siajn partojn egale kompletajn.
Please note that the word "salute" in line 68 can also mean "health" or "well-being" in English, so another possible translation of the second line is: "greater well-being requires a greater body".
Also, the word "cape" in line 68 can also mean "to contain" or "to hold" in English, so another possible translation of the second line is: "greater salvation is contained in a greater body".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
70 Dunque costui che tutto quanto rape 71 l’altro universo seco, corrisponde 72 al cerchio che più ama e che più sape:
73 per che, se tu a la virtù circonde 74 la tua misura, non a la parvenza 75 de le sustanze che t’appaion tonde,
76 tu vederai mirabil consequenza 77 di maggio a più e di minore a meno, 78 in ciascun cielo, a süa intelligenza».
query.result:
English:
70 Therefore this one, which sweeps along with it 71 the entire other universe, corresponds 72 to the circle that loves most and that knows most:
73 because if you measure your standard 74 by the virtue, not by the appearance 75 of the substances that appear to you as round,
76 you will see a marvelous consequence 77 from greater to more and from lesser to less, 78 in each heaven, according to its intelligence.
Esperanto:
70 Sekve ĉi tiu kiu kun si trenas la tutan 71 alian universon, korespondas 72 al la ĉielosfero kiu plej amas kaj kiu plej scias:
73 ĉar se vi al la virto ĉirkaŭvolvas 74 vian mezuron, ne al la ŝajno 75 de la substancoj kiuj aperas al vi rondaj,
76 vi vidos mirindan konsekvencon 77 de pli granda al pli kaj de pli malgranda al malpli, 78 en ĉiu ĉielo, laŭ ĝia inteligenteco.
Please note that the word "consequenza" in line 76 can also mean "consequence" or "implication" in English, so another possible translation of the sixth line is: "you will see a marvelous implication".
Also, the word "intelligenza" in line 78 can also mean "intelligence" or "understanding" in English, so another possible translation of the last line is: "in each heaven, according to its understanding".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
79 Come rimane splendido e sereno 80 l’emisperio de l’aere, quando soffia 81 Borea da quella guancia ond’ è più leno,
82 per che si purga e risolve la roffia 83 che pria turbava, sì che ’l ciel ne ride 84 con le bellezze d’ogne sua paroffia;
85 così fec’ïo, poi che mi provide 86 la donna mia del suo risponder chiaro, 87 e come stella in cielo il ver si vide.
query.result:
English:
79 As the hemisphere of the air remains splendid and serene 80 when Boreas blows from that cheek from which it is gentler,
81 because it purges and dissolves the mist 82 that previously troubled it, so that the sky laughs at it 83 with the beauties of all its regions;
84 so did I, after my lady provided me 85 with her clear answer, 86 and the truth was seen like a star in the sky.
Esperanto:
79 Kiel restas brila kaj serena 80 la duonsfero de la aero, kiam blovas 81 Boreo de tiu vango de kie ĝi estas pli milda,
82 ĉar ĝi puriĝas kaj solvas la nebulon 83 kiu antaŭe ĝenis, tiel ke la ĉielo ridas al ĝi 84 kun la belecoj de ĉiu sia paroĥo;
85 tiel faris mi, post kiam mia damo provizis min 86 per sia klara respondo, 87 kaj kiel stelo en la ĉielo la vero videblis.
Please note that the word "roffia" in line 82 can also mean "scum" or "dross" in English, so another possible translation of the third line is: "because it purges and dissolves the scum that previously troubled it".
Also, the word "paroffia" in line 84 can also mean "parish" or "diocese" in English, so another possible translation of the fifth line is: "with the beauties of all its parishes".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
88 E poi che le parole sue restaro, 89 non altrimenti ferro disfavilla 90 che bolle, come i cerchi sfavillaro.
query.result:
English:
88 And after her words ceased, 89 no differently does iron sparkle 90 that is boiling, than how the circles sparkled.
Esperanto:
88 Kaj post kiam ŝiaj vortoj ĉesis, 89 ne alie fero ekbrilas 90 kiu bolas, kiel la ĉielosferoj ekbrilis.
Please note that the word "disfavilla" in line 89 can also mean "to sparkle" or "to scintillate" in English, so another possible translation of the second line is: "no differently does iron scintillate".
Also, the word "bolle" in line 90 can also mean "to boil" or "to bubble" in English, so another possible translation of the third line is: "that is bubbling, than how the circles bubbled".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
91 L’incendio suo seguiva ogne scintilla; 92 ed eran tante, che ’l numero loro 93 più che ’l doppiar de li scacchi s’inmilla.
query.result:
English:
91 Its fire followed every spark; 92 and there were so many of them that their number 93 is more like the doubling of the squares on a chessboard.
Esperanto:
91 Ĝia incendio sekvis ĉiun scintilon; 92 kaj estis tiom da ili, ke ilia nombro 93 pli similas al la duobligado de la kvadratoj sur ŝaktabulo.
Please note that the word "scintilla" in line 91 can also mean "spark" or "spangle" in English, so another possible translation of the first line is: "Its fire followed every spangle".
Also, the word "s'inmilla" in line 93 can also mean "to resemble" or "to be similar to" in English, so another possible translation of the last line is: "is more similar to the doubling of the squares on a chessboard".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
94 Io sentiva osannar di coro in coro 95 al punto fisso che li tiene a li ubi, 96 e terrà sempre, ne’ quai sempre fuoro.
query.result:
English:
94 I heard hosannas sung from choir to choir 95 to the fixed point that holds them to their wheres, 96 and will always hold them, in which they always were.
Esperanto:
94 Mi aŭdis hozanojn kantitajn de ĥoro al ĥoro 95 al la fiksa punkto kiu tenas ilin al iliaj kie, 96 kaj tenos ĉiam, en kiuj ili ĉiam estis.
Please note that the word "osannar" in line 94 can also mean "praises" or "adorations" in English, so another possible translation of the first line is: "I heard praises sung from choir to choir".
Also, the word "ubi" in line 95 can also mean "places" or "locations" in English, so another possible translation of the second line is: "to the fixed point that holds them to their places".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
97 E quella che vedëa i pensier dubi 98 ne la mia mente, disse: «I cerchi primi 99 t’hanno mostrato Serafi e Cherubi.
query.result:
English:
97 And she who saw the doubtful thoughts 98 in my mind, said: "The first circles 99 have shown you Seraphim and Cherubim.
Esperanto:
97 Kaj tiu kiu vidis la dubajn pensojn 98 en mia menso, diris: "La unuaj ĉielosferoj 99 montris al vi Serafojn kaj Kerubojn.
Please note that the word "dubbi" in line 98 can also mean "uncertain" or "wavering" in English, so another possible translation of the second line is: "in my mind, said: 'The first circles have shown you Seraphim and Cherubim'".
Also, the word "Serafi" in line 99 can also be translated as "Seraphim" in English, so another possible translation of the last line is: "have shown you Seraphim and Cherubim".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
100 Così veloci seguono i suoi vimi, 101 per somigliarsi al punto quanto ponno; 102 e posson quanto a veder son soblimi.
query.result:
English:
100 So swiftly do their movements follow, 101 in order to resemble the point as much as they can; 102 and they can as much as they are sublime to behold.
Esperanto:
100 Tiel rapide sekvas iliaj movoj, 101 por similiĝi al la punkto kiom ili povas; 102 kaj ili povas kiom ili estas sublimaj por rigardi.
Please note that the word "vimi" in line 100 can also mean "powers" or "forces" in English, so another possible translation of the first line is: "So swiftly do their powers follow".
Also, the word "soblimi" in line 102 can also mean "lofty" or "exalted" in English, so another possible translation of the last line is: "and they can as much as they are lofty to behold".

English:
103 Those other loves that circle around them 104 are called Thrones of the divine aspect, 105 because they terminated the first triad;
106 and you should know that all of them have delight 107 to the extent that their sight penetrates deeply 108 into the truth in which every intellect finds peace.
Esperanto:
103 Tiuj aliaj amoj kiuj ĉirkaŭas ilin 104 nomiĝas Tronojn de la dia aspekto, 105 ĉar ili finis la unuan ternaron;
106 kaj vi devas scii ke ĉiuj havas plezuron 107 kiom ilia vido profundiĝas 108 en la vero en kiu kvietiĝas ĉiu intelekto.
Please note that the word "vonno" in line 103 can also mean "surround" or "encircle" in English, so another possible translation of the first line is: "Those other loves that surround them".
Also, the word "ternaro" in line 105 can also mean "triad" or "trinity" in English, so another possible translation of the fourth line is: "because they terminated the first triad".

English:
109 Hence one can see how blessed existence is founded 110 in the act of seeing, 111 not in that of loving, which comes second;
112 and the measure of seeing is merit, 113 which gives birth to grace and good will: 114 thus one proceeds from grade to grade.
Esperanto:
109 De tie oni povas vidi kiel fondiĝas 110 la beata ekzisto en la ago kiu vidas, 111 ne en tiu kiu amas, kiu poste sekvas;
112 kaj la mezuro de la vidado estas merito, 113 kiu naskigas gracon kaj bonan volon: 114 tiel oni procedas de grado al grado.
Please note that the word "mercede" in line 112 can also mean "reward" or "recompense" in English, so another possible translation of the fourth line is: "and the reward of seeing is merit".
Also, the word "volglia" in line 113 can also be spelled "voglia" in Italian, which means "will" or "desire" in English, so another possible translation of the fifth line is: "which gives birth to grace and desire".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
115 L’altro ternaro, che così germoglia 116 in questa primavera sempiterna 117 che notturno Arïete non dispoglia,
118 perpetüalemente ‘Osanna’ sberna 119 con tre melode, che suonano in tree 120 ordini di letizia onde s’interna.
query.result:
English:
115 The other triad, which thus blossoms 116 in this eternal spring 117 that the nocturnal Ram does not despoil,
118 perpetually intones 'Hosanna' 119 with three melodies, which resound in three 120 orders of joy in which it is contained.
Esperanto:
115 La alia ternaro, kiu tiel burĝonas 116 en ĉi tiu eterna printempo 117 kiun nokta Ŝafo ne senvestigas,
118 senĉese kantas ‘Hosanna’ 119 per tri melodioj, kiuj sonoras en tri 120 ordoj de ĝojo en kiuj ĝi enestas.
Please note that the word "germoglia" in line 116 can also mean "buds" or "sprouts" in English, so another possible translation of the second line is: "which thus buds in this eternal spring".
Also, the word "Arïete" in line 117 is the Latin name for the constellation Aries, so another possible translation of the third line is: "that the nocturnal constellation Aries does not despoil".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
121 In essa gerarcia son l’altre dee: 122 prima Dominazioni, e poi Virtudi; 123 l’ordine terzo di Podestadi èe.
query.result:
English:
121 In this hierarchy are the other gods: 122 first, Dominations, and then Virtues; 123 the third order is that of Powers.
Esperanto:
121 En tiu hierarkio estas la aliaj dioj: 122 unue Regantoj, kaj poste Virtoj; 123 la tria ordo estas tiu de Povoj.
Please note that the word "dee" in line 121 can also mean "goddesses" in English, so another possible translation of the first line is: "In this hierarchy are the other gods and goddesses".
Also, the word "Podestadi" in line 123 can also be translated as "Powers" in English, so another possible translation of the last line is: "the third order is that of Powers".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
124 Poscia ne’ due penultimi tripudi 125 Principati e Arcangeli si girano; 126 l’ultimo è tutto d’Angelici ludi.
query.result:
English:
124 Then in the two penultimate circles 125 Principalities and Archangels revolve; 126 the last is all of Angelic games.
Esperanto:

Please note that the word "tripudi" in line 124 can also mean "dances" or "revelries" in English, so another possible translation of the first line is: "Then in the two penultimate dances".
Also, the word "ludi" in line 126 can also mean "sports" or "pastimes" in English, so another possible translation of the last line is: "the last is all of Angelic sports".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
127 Questi ordini di sù tutti s’ammirano, 128 e di giù vincon sì, che verso Dio 129 tutti tirati sono e tutti tirano.
query.result:
English:
127 These orders above all admire each other, 128 and they so conquer those below, that toward God 129 all are drawn and all draw.
Esperanto:
127 Ĉi tiuj ordoj de supre ĉiuj admiras unu la alian, 128 kaj de malsupre venkas tiel, ke al Dio 129 ĉiuj estas altiritaj kaj ĉiuj altiras.
Please note that the word "ammirano" in line 127 can also mean "marvel at" or "wonder at" in English, so another possible translation of the first line is: "These orders above all marvel at each other".
Also, the word "vincon" in line 128 can also mean "overcome" or "subdue" in English, so another possible translation of the second line is: "and they so overcome those below".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
130 E Dïonisio con tanto disio 131 a contemplar questi ordini si mise, 132 che li nomò e distinse com’ io.
query.result:
English:
130 And Dionysius with such desire 131 set himself to contemplate these orders, 132 that he named and distinguished them as I have.
Esperanto:
130 Kaj Dionizio kun tiom da deziro 131 sin donis al kontemplado de ĉi tiuj ordoj, 132 ke li nomis kaj distingis kiel mi.
Please note that the word "disio" in line 130 can also mean "longing" or "yearning" in English, so another possible translation of the first line is: "And Dionysius with such longing".
Also, the word "nomò" in line 132 can also mean "named" or "designated" in English, so another possible translation of the fourth line is: "that he named and designated them as I have".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
133 Ma Gregorio da lui poi si divise; 134 onde, sì tosto come li occhi aperse 135 in questo ciel, di sé medesmo rise.
query.result:
English:
133 But Gregory then departed from him; 134 therefore, as soon as he opened his eyes 135 in this heaven, he laughed at himself.
Esperanto:
133 Sed Gregorio poste de li disiĝis; 134 pro tio, tuj kiam li malfermis la okulojn 135 en ĉi tiu ĉielo, li ridis pri si mem.
Please note that the word "divise" in line 133 can also mean "separated" or "parted" in English, so another possible translation of the first line is: "But Gregory then separated from him".
Also, the word "rise" in line 135 can also mean "laughed" or "smiled" in English, so another possible translation of the last line is: "in this heaven, he smiled at himself".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English and Esperanto.
136 E se tanto secreto ver proferse 137 mortale in terra, non voglio ch’ammiri: 138 ché chi ’l vide qua sù gliel discoperse
139 con altro assai del ver di questi giri».
query.result:
English:
136 And if a mortal on earth uttered so great a secret, 137 I do not want you to marvel: 138 for he who saw it up here revealed it to him,
139 along with much else of the truth of these circles.
Esperanto:
136 Kaj se tiom da sekreto vere proferis 137 mortonto en la tero, mi ne volas ke vi miru: 138 ĉar tiu kiu ĝin vidis ĉi supre ĝin malkovris al li,
139 kun multe alia de la vero de ĉi tiuj ĉielosferoj».
Please note that the word "proferse" in line 136 can also mean "uttered" or "spoke" in English, so another possible translation of the first line is: "And if a mortal on earth uttered so great a secret".
Also, the word "ammiri" in line 137 can also mean "marvel at" or "wonder at" in English, so another possible translation of the second line is: "I do not want you to marvel at".
